resources.string: This application requests permission to connect your mobile device to the cloud.
This device is currently connected to the cloud as %1$s.
To receive notifications from this app, you must first create an account.
Select the account you wish to authorize:
Main Menu minesweeper, you can navigate through the menu by making simple taps in the different options and just make a long press to select one of the options below

The board is a grid of cells, and some of them are hiding a mine. Your goal is to find all of those mines, without detonating any of them.

 To accomplish that, you can press any cell -dig mode- or mark it -exploration mode- with a flag,if you are sure it contains a mine. When you press a cell, several cells can be discovered, and they will show you how many mines are around them.

 

 Options: make use of the settings while in the main menu in order to turn on Speech synthesizer as well as music.

To play Android Minesweeper there are several controls you should know:


Buttons, use:
 - menu button - listen to cell coordinates
 - search button - switch between exploration and dig mode
 - volume up button - turn on/off zoom mode
 - volume down button - listen to controls hints
 - call button - listen to cell context information, that is, you will listen every cell information, that surround the selected one, beginning at the top cell and ending at the top left cell in clockwise order.


If you don't have any of this buttons, you can change them, by clicking on Key Configurations.


Play with touch screen, use:
 - one tap, to select a cell
 - two taps, to dig a cell
 - three taps, to explore a cell
 - drag, to listen different features of the cell


Play with keyboard, use:
 - arrows, to select a cell
 - enter button or similar, to dig or explore


While in zoom mode, enter button or tap to dig or explore.
You have to complete the form

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. To fulfill these goals, we would like to know some details about you and how you interact with technologies in general and games in particular. This will help us to interpret your answers to this questionnaire. All the information collected through this questionnaire will be anonymous, untraceable and will be treated confidentially and only used for the purpose of the study. \n
Mark the option that better describes your current visual level
Rate how often you play games in your computer or game console. Where 1 means "Never" and 5 "very often"
Rate how often you play games in your mobile device (phone or tablet). Where 1 means "Never" and 5 "very often"
Please rate how easy/difficult it was to learn to play. Where 1 means "very difficult" and 5 "very easy".
Rate how fun it was to play. Where 1 means "very boring" and 5 "very fun".
Rate how engaging was the game. Where 1 means "not engaging" and 5 "very engaging".
Rate how pleasant or frustrating was the interaction with the game. Where 1 means "very frustrating" and 5 "very pleasant".
Rate how you liked the story and narrative atmosphere (if applicable). Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Rate how you liked the accessibility and control settings. Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Rate how you liked the feedback provide by the game. Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Finally, please provide any comments or suggestions to improve the game. Then tap on "Finish" to send the responses to us, and that\'s all!
To go to the next tip, do a tap in the top of the screen.
To finish, do a tap in the top of the screen.
In this tutorial, you are learning the game basics.
You can do a tap on the screen to select a cell and to listen its state. Try to do it on this screen!.
You can do double tap on the screen to dig a cell. Try to do it on this screen!.
You can do triple tap on the screen to explore a non pushed cell or to non explore a explored cell. Try to do it on this screen!.
You will be able to check out how to change the selected cell using drag events. Check it out!

In Accessible Minesweeper you can assign some keys to some actions. Some of them are:
 Instructions reading: To remember how to play, using the key Menu by default.
 Coordinates: To read the cell state and coordinates, using the key Menu by default.. 
 The more complex actions like Zoom mode, exploration mode or Read cell context are explained in tutorial next steps Now, try to use them!.

Zoom mode allows you select a cell easier, only clicking in the center of the screen. If you do a tap in some of the screen ends you will be changing the focused cell. Remember only a tap!. Moreover the way of interact changes. Now you have to do a tap to dig and a double tap to flag a cell To enables zoom mode you must use the key Volume Up by default. Now, try to use it !.
Exploration mode allows you flag cells independently of the event, simple double or triple tap. Check it out!.
It\'s an additional option that reads the cell states around the focused cell. Check it out!.
